snippet: New Yorkers have a chance to prove to Bostonians what gracious winners they can be on a free trip. Or they can go lord it over the hapless beaneaters.
abstract: New Yorkers have a chance to prove to Bostonians what gracious winners they can be on a free trip. Or they can go lord it over the hapless beaneaters.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 1:21 p.m. Thursday | So apparently this attempt at mock-bad-sportsmanship was perceived by many readers as a failure - that is, a descent into real bad sportsmanship. City Room would like to state for the record that (1) we  don't really think that Boston is a city of losers; (2) as several readers pointed out, Boston has had more than its share of champions in recent years; (3) some of our best friends, not to mention our boss, are current or former Bostonians; and (4) we promise never to try this particular rhetorical device again. We apologize to those we've offended.

headline.main: Go to Loserville, Mayor Tells New Yorkers
